intro: Tithymalus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
